Package com.atakmap.opengl

Class GLTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.opengl.GLTexture
  • public final class GLTexture
extends java.lang.Object
    An OpenGL texture or sub-texture.

      static void createQuadMeshIndexBuffer​(int numCellsX, int numCellsY, java.nio.ShortBuffer buffer)  
      static void createQuadMeshTexCoords​(float minX, float minY, float maxX, float maxY, int numCellsX, int numCellsY, java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)
      This is does the same thing as createQuadMeshTexCoords(PointF, PointF, PointF, PointF, int, int, FloatBuffer) but takes in the coordinates equal to calling createQuadMeshTexCoords(new PointF(minX, minY), new PointF(maxX, minY), new PointF(maxX, maxY), new PointF(minX, maxY), numCellsX, numCellsY, buffer)

        public int getTexId()

        Returns:

      • getTexWidth

        public int getTexWidth()
        Get the width in pixels of the (base-most) texture
        Returns:
        the texture width in pixels or -1 if the texture memory has not been initialized

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the texture data. Only the object responsible for creating this texture should call this. Any other entity that uses the texture should call recycle().

        public void draw​(int numCoords,
                 int type,
                 java.nio.Buffer textureCoordinates,
                 java.nio.Buffer vertexCoordinates)
        Draws this texture in the current context using the specified texture and vertex coordinates.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the texture and vertex coordinates (e.g. GL_FLOAT)
        textureCoordinates - The texture coordinates
        vertexCoordinates - The vertex coordinates

      • getNumQuadMeshVertices

      • createQuadMeshTexCoords

        public static void createQuadMeshTexCoords​(float minX,
                                           float minY,
                                           float maxX,
                                           float maxY,
                                           int numCellsX,
                                           int numCellsY,
                                           java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)
        This is does the same thing as createQuadMeshTexCoords(PointF, PointF, PointF, PointF, int, int, FloatBuffer) but takes in the coordinates equal to calling createQuadMeshTexCoords(new PointF(minX, minY), new PointF(maxX, minY), new PointF(maxX, maxY), new PointF(minX, maxY), numCellsX, numCellsY, buffer)
        Parameters:
        minX - The minimum x value
        minY - The minimum y value
        maxX - The maximum x value
        maxY - The maximum y value
        numCellsX - The number of cells across minX to maxX
        numCellsY - The number of cells across minY to maxY
        buffer - The buffer to store the texture coordinates inside

      • createQuadMeshTexCoords

        public static void createQuadMeshTexCoords​(android.graphics.PointF upperLeft,
                                           android.graphics.PointF upperRight,
                                           android.graphics.PointF lowerRight,
                                           android.graphics.PointF lowerLeft,
                                           int numCellsX,
                                           int numCellsY,
                                           java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)

                                           int numCellsY,
                                           java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)
